title: E0623 highlights wrong parameter in async fn

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: NLL-fixed-by-NLL
labels.description: Bugs fixed, but only when NLL is enabled.

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Polish
labels.description: Async-await issues that are part of the "polish" area

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Triaged
labels.description: Async-await issues that have been triaged during a working group meeting.

labels.name: D-incorrect
labels.description: A diagnostic that is giving misleading or incorrect information

body:
```rust
struct Struct { }

impl Struct {
    async fn async_fn(self: &Struct, f: &u32) -> &u32 {
        f
    }
    
    fn sync_fn(self: &Struct, f: &u32) -> &u32 {
        f
    }
}
```

Output ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=c4cfd4b3a84d86ea5e43494b8c11aa0f))

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0623]: lifetime mismatch
 --> src/main.rs:5:9
  |
4 |     async fn async_fn(self: &Struct, f: &u32) -> &u32 {
  |                             -------              ----
  |                             |
  |                             this parameter and the return type are declared with different lifetimes...
5 |         f
  |         ^ ...but data from `f` is returned here

error[E0623]: lifetime mismatch
 --> src/main.rs:9:9
  |
8 |     fn sync_fn(self: &Struct, f: &u32) -> &u32 {
  |                                  ----     ----
  |                                  |
  |                                  this parameter and the return type are declared with different lifetimes...
9 |         f
  |         ^ ...but data from `f` is returned here

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0623`.
error: could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

The error in `sync_fn` is correct, but the one for `async_fn` incorrectly claims the return type lifetime is different from `self`'s lifetime, when they are in fact the same per the elision rules.
